questions.text: What are the names of the Elliot sisters, from eldest to youngest?
questions.explanation:
Elizabeth, Anne, Mary.

	Until the book's end, Mary, the youngest, is the only married sister.

questions.text: Who persuaded Anne to refuse Captain Wentworth's first marriage proposal?
questions.explanation:
Lady Russell.

	Lady Russell had been a dear friend of Anne's late mother.

questions.text: Which Musgrove sister does Captain Wentworth seem to prefer?
questions.explanation:
Louisa.

	Captain Wentworth never falls in love with either Musgrove sister.

questions.text: How many years go by from the time Anne turns Captain Wentworth down to the time she meets him again at the Musgroves' home?
questions.explanation:
more than seven.

	Anne is 19 when Wentworth first proposes to her.

questions.text: What is the Musgrove sisters' relationship like?
options: They are envious of each other.
They don't know each other very well.
questions.explanation:
They are good friends.

	These sisters get along far better than the Elliot sisters.

questions.text: Where does an accident befall Louisa Musgrove?
questions.explanation:
Lyme & Cobb.

	Louisa's high spirits cause her recklessness.

questions.text: What is Sir Walter's main character trait?
questions.explanation:
vanity.

	Sir Walter is constantly thinking of his own--and other people's--appearance.

questions.text: Why doesn't Captain Wentworth ask Anne to marry him soon after they meet again?
options: He is in love with Henrietta.
questions.explanation:
He is too proud.

	Although he doesn't know it, Wentworth never stops loving Anne.

questions.text: Which two men marry the Musgrove sisters?
questions.explanation:
Hayter Benwick & Benwick Hayter.

	Henrietta marries her cousin Charles Hayter. Louisa marries Captain Benwick, who was to have married Captain Harville's sister.

questions.text: Who is Sir Walter's second wife?
questions.explanation:
no one.

	Anne and Lady Russell are worried that Sir Walter may marry Mrs. Clay, but she runs off with Mr. Elliot.
